Stephen.text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple releases an iPad Pro with a screen between 15.0 and 15.9999 inches which replaces the 11-inch model
Stephen.notes: • Was originally just "15 inch" but a specific range was requested after Federico's pick was read.

Stephen.text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
Stephen.full-pick-text: No Intel Macs are left on sale (as new) at the end of 2023
Stephen.notes: • "Does not include the refurbished or educational stores." Or, in other words, the Intel Mac Minis and Mac Pro are not sold as new anymore (and of course they don't introduce a new Intel Mac).

Stephen.text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
Stephen.full-pick-text: WWDC 2023 follows the same format as WWDC 2022, with a small number of people invited in person
Stephen.notes: • No convention center, no ticket lottery, just like in 2022.

Stephen.text: Apple will announce a 15-inch MacBook Air
Stephen.full-pick-text: Apple will announce a 15-inch MacBook Air

Stephen.text: The announced price of the headset will be less than $2,500
Stephen.full-pick-text: The announced price of the headset will be less than $2,500

Stephen.text: The phrase "one more thing" will be used before the headset is announced
Stephen.full-pick-text: The phrase "one more thing" will be used before the headset is announced

Myke.notes:
• Seems inevitable but it might be a bit ahead of its time.
  • Ungraded: might just be the Pro phones, to advertise the improved transfer speeds.

Myke.text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple releases a larger MacBook Air

Myke.text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple shows off their headset in March, they announce developer tools at WWDC, then show it off again at an event in September. It ships to customers in October

Myke.text: Apple introduces a Copilot-like feature for Xcode powered by AI/ML
Myke.full-pick-text: Apple introduces a Copilot-like feature for Xcode powered by AI/ML
Myke.notes: • Not graded: "A feature in Xcode that uses AI/ML to suggest how to improve your code or solve common problems. It will most likely live in a sidebar and will probably be a Beta feature."

• Indeed, this pick has been made a few times, but the only one Myke is ineligible to pick is his much more detailed and already incorrect annual pick.
  • Federico makes some implausible claims about his involvement in the development of the headset.
• Was originally "A widget-like interface comes to the Apple Watch" before some workshopping.

Federico.text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple releases a new Mac mini
Federico.notes: • Ungraded: Probably the same design but with an M2 chip. More Thunderbolt ports would be nice.

Federico.text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches...
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple will release its biggest iPad ever with a display of at least 16 inches. It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio.
Federico.notes: • "... It won't be OLED, it'll have the front-facing camera on the landscape side, and two USB-C ports at least. It'll be called iPad Studio."

Federico.text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini
Federico.full-pick-text: There will not be an iPhone 15 mini

Federico.text: Apple introduces a brand new journaling app
Federico.full-pick-text: Apple introduces a brand new journaling app
Federico.notes: • Not graded: "location features for friends, ability to take notes and attach images, maybe integration with Music?"

Federico.text: The Health app gets mood tracking and an iPad version
Federico.full-pick-text: The Health app gets mood tracking and an iPad version

Federico.text: The next version of iPadOS will introduce a brand new audio routing system, with support for selecting different input sources, similar to macOS...
Federico.full-pick-text: The next version of iPadOS will introduce a brand new audio routing system, with support for selecting different input sources, similar to macOS. This feature will finally allow podcasters like me to record local audio while also being on a FaceTime or Zoom call (assuming apps add support for it).
Federico.notes:
• "... This feature will finally allow podcasters like me to record local audio while also being on a FaceTime or Zoom call (assuming apps add support for it)."
  • And there's even more that isn't graded: "Devices that do not require drivers will work out of the box, like in macOS. I think the Sounds page of Settings will be redesigned."
  • Federico guesses that this is his longest-ever Risky Pick, and he's right, this is in fact his longest ever pick period, beating out this one from earlier the same year.
